required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: VL vs DL in Inexperienced Users: a Pediatric Manikin Study
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Miller and Macintosh Laryngoscopes, CMAC and Glidescope Videolaryngoscopes in Inexperienced Users: a Pediatric Manikin Study

brief_summary.textblock: This study will compare the CMAC and Glidescope videolaryngoscopes (VL) to traditional direct laryngoscopy (DL) using either a Miller or Macintosh laryngoscope by studying the performance of users. This will involve the use of an intubating pediatric manikin to assess various aspects of endotracheal intubation by experienced and inexperienced users.

detailed_description.textblock: The commonly used method for endotracheal intubation in children is direct laryngoscopy using a Miller or Macintosh blade. Videolaryngoscopy is a widely accepted pediatric airway management. Videolaryngoscopes (VL) provide an indirect view of glottis without the need to align the oral, pharyngeal, and glottis structures. Some types of VLs provide also direct view of glottis with indirect view. Videolaryngoscopes can be used as a teaching tool for learners as they can visualize all the anatomical structures of larynx at the same time with the performer. VLs may facilitate the learning of endotracheal intubation in inexperienced users in the pediatric population. There are limited data on the use of videolaryngoscopes by anesthesia providers and medical personnel who are inexperienced in the use of videolaryngoscopes.

primary_outcome.measure: Length of time of intubation between VL and DL
primary_outcome.time_frame: the same day (within seconds to minutes), through study completion, an average of 1 year
primary_outcome.description: whether time to intubation is shorter with VL as compared to DL

arm_group.description: Inexperienced users will include trainees (SRNAs, residents, fellows, and medical students) and nurses at NCH.
Experienced users will include faculty pediatric anesthesiologists CRNAs.

intervention.description: Each participant will perform endotracheal intubation on the mannequin using videolaryngoscopes (VL) and traditional direct laryngoscopy (DL).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Faculty pediatric anesthesiologists
- CRNAs
- Trainees (SRNAs, residents, fellows, and medical students)
- Nurses from NCH
Exclusion Criteria:
- If subjects are unwilling to participate.
